ckMem -- Memory management module

Provides the functionality to handle memory. More...

Detailed Description

Provides the functionality to handle memory.

Define Documentation

#define ckDelete ( ptr,
type   ) 

Value:

do \
    { \
        if (!ckMemMgr::isCreated()) \
        { \
            break; \
        } \
    \
        void* ptr_ = ptr; \
    \
        if (ckMemMgr::getMemoryBlockArraySize(ptr_) > 0) \
        { \
            ckThrow(ckMemMgr::ExceptionInvalidCall); \
        } \
    \
        reinterpret_cast<type*>(ptr_)->~type(); \
        ckMemMgr::freeForSystem(ptr_); \
    } \
    while (false)
The operator delete.

Parameters:
[in] ptr An instance to be deleted.
[in] type The type of a class.

#define ckDeleteArray ( ptr,
type   ) 

Value:

do \
    { \
        if (!ckMemMgr::isCreated()) \
        { \
            break; \
        } \
    \
        void* ptr_ = ptr; \
        u32 array_size = ckMemMgr::getMemoryBlockArraySize(ptr_); \
    \
        if (array_size == 0) \
        { \
            ckThrow(ckMemMgr::ExceptionInvalidCall); \
        } \
    \
        for (u32 i = 0; i < array_size; i++) \
        { \
            reinterpret_cast<type*>(ptr_)[i].~type(); \
        } \
    \
        ckMemMgr::freeForSystem(ptr_); \
    } \
    while (false)
The operator delete for an array.

Parameters:
[in] ptr The instance to be deleted.
[in] type The type of a class.

#define ckNewArray ( var,
type,
array_size   ) 

Value:

do \
    { \
        var = reinterpret_cast<type*>(ckMemMgr::mallocForSystem(sizeof(type) * array_size, array_size, __FILE__)); \
    \
        for (u32 i = 0; i < array_size; i++) \
        { \
            new(&var[i], NULL) type; \
        } \
    } \
    while (false)
The operator new for an array.

Parameters:
[out] var The created instance.
[in] type The type of a class.
[in] array_size The size of an array.
